lead_paragraph: A coalition of editors and busi ness managers of seven student publications in California is lobbying in Sacramento for a bill exempting free student publications from a new sales tax that the group says could damage or even bankrupt some student newspapers. The new law, which went into effect July 15, levies a 7.25 percent sales tax on paper and ink for all free publications in the state. For publication that are not free, the tax is levied on the amount the reader pays.

headline.main: Campus Life: U.C.L.A.; Student Papers Seek Exemption From New Tax
